Italian_Sentence: Historically falls on the full moon of the lunar month of Vesākha but in modern calendars is typically celebrated on the first full moon of May

Italian_Sentence: Historically falls on the full moon of the lunar month of Vesākha but in modern calendars is typically celebrated on the first full moon of May
Italian_Sentence_IPA: Also known as Buddha Day, it commemorates Buddha's birth, enlightenment, and death.

Italian_Sentence: Full moon of the 3rd lunar month
Italian_Sentence_IPA: Also known as Sangha Day, it honors the Buddha's teachings and monastic community.

Italian_Sentence: Full moon of Āsādha in the Lunar calendar; typically July in the Gregorian calendar

Italian_Sentence: Full moon of Aashvin in the Lunar calendar; typically October in the Gregorian calendar

Italian_Sentence: Beginning after the month of the full moon of the 11th month in the Lunar calendar; typically in October in the Gregorian calendar
Italian_Sentence_IPA: Buddhist festival which occurs after the end of Vassa (the three month rainy season) for offering robes to monks.
Day dedicated to mindfulness of breathing meditation in honor of the Buddha's teachings on mindfulness of breathing (Ānāpānasati Sutta).

Italian_Sentence: Uposatha is typically observed about once a week in Theravada countries in accordance with the four lunar phases: the new moon, the full moon, and the two quarter moons in between
Italian_Sentence_IPA: The Buddha taught that the Uposatha day is for 'the cleansing of the defiled mind', resulting in inner calm and joy.
